cards.name: Elspeth, Sun's Champion
cards.text:
+1: Put three 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
−3: Destroy all creatures with power 4 or greater.
−7: You get an emblem with "Creatures you control get +2/+2 and have flying."

cards.flavor: "Oathbreaker, I cast you out!"
cards.name: Banisher Priest
cards.text: When Banisher Priest enters the battlefield, exile target creature an opponent controls until Banisher Priest leaves the battlefield. (That creature returns under its owner's control.)

cards.name: Captain of the Watch
cards.text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Other Soldier creatures you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.
When Captain of the Watch enters the battlefield, put three 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"You were defeated the moment you declared your aggression."
—Gideon Jura
cards.name: Celestial Flare
cards.text: Target player sacrifices an attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor: "The Boros fight for justice. The Azorius fight for law. I hold the line between, and make sure the people are given both."
cards.name: Court Street Denizen
cards.text: Whenever another white creature enters the battlefield under your control, tap target creature an opponent controls.

cards.flavor:
"The people of Akros must learn from our leonin adversaries. If we match their staunch ferocity with our superior faith, we cannot fail."
—Cymede, queen of Akros
cards.name: Dauntless Onslaught
cards.text: Up to two target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Decree of Justice
cards.text:
Put X 4/4 white Angel creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
Cycling {2}{W} ({2}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Justice, you may pay {X}. If you do, put X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"In our war Heliod gave mortals some favor, yet other times he withheld aid. Are we still no more than game pieces to him?"
—Polyxene the Doubter
cards.name: Dictate of Heliod
cards.text:
Flash
Creatures you control get +2/+2.

cards.name: Gempalm Avenger
cards.text:
Cycling {2}{W} ({2}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Avenger, Soldier creatures get +1/+1 and gain first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Banking steeply, the aven streaked toward the ground—and vanished.
cards.name: Gustcloak Harrier
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Gustcloak Harrier becomes blocked, you may untap it and remove it from combat.

cards.flavor:
"Our death-arrows flew in high arcs towards the aven. And then . . . nothing."
—Coliseum guard
cards.name: Gustcloak Savior
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked, you may untap that creature and remove it from combat.

cards.flavor: Entire platoons have mysteriously vanished from battle, leaving enemy weapons to slice through empty air.
cards.name: Gustcloak Sentinel
cards.text: Whenever Gustcloak Sentinel becomes blocked, you may untap it and remove it from combat.

cards.flavor: They're trained in the art of pressing their luck.
cards.name: Gustcloak Skirmisher
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Gustcloak Skirmisher becomes blocked, you may untap it and remove it from combat.

cards.name: Icatian Javelineers
cards.text:
Icatian Javelineers enters the battlefield with a javelin counter on it.
{T}, Remove a javelin counter from Icatian Javelineers: Icatian Javelineers deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: "If a boggart even dares breathe near one of my kin, I'll know. And I'll not be happy."
cards.name: Kinsbaile Skirmisher
cards.text: When Kinsbaile Skirmisher enters the battlefield, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Sometimes I snare the unexpected, but I know its purpose will be revealed in time."
cards.name: Kor Skyfisher
cards.text:
Flying
When Kor Skyfisher enters the battlefield, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor:
"On every plane I've encountered loxodons, I've found stalwart and loyal friends."
—Elspeth
cards.name: Loxodon Partisan
cards.text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor:
"The southern fortress taken by invaders? Heh, sure . . . when elephants fly."
—Brezard Skeinbow, captain of the guard
cards.name: Mighty Leap
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor:
"Such deeds should be common fare for such as us."
—Anax, king of Akros
cards.name: Mortal's Ardor
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: She will not touch a weapon, yet she is the greatest protector her people have ever known.
cards.name: Mother of Runes
cards.text: {T}: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Noble Templar
cards.text:
Vigilance
Plainscycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Plains card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.flavor: "In troubled times, we all need someone to watch our back."
cards.name: Precinct Captain
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever Precinct Captain deals combat damage to a player, put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Like blinking or breathing, responding to an alarm is an involuntary reflex.
cards.name: Raise the Alarm
cards.text: Put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"I was called to this world of steel, and it will be my steel that answers."
—Elspeth
cards.name: Soul Parry
cards.text: Prevent all damage one or two target creatures would deal this turn.

cards.flavor:
"Bant sentries were called the Angel Line. They never faltered, and they were ready to die defending their position."
—Elspeth
cards.name: Standing Troops
cards.text: Vigilance

cards.flavor:
"It's easy for the innocent to speak of justice. They seldom feel its terrible power."
—Orim, Samite inquisitor
cards.name: Sunlance
cards.text: Sunlance deals 3 damage to target nonwhite creature.

cards.flavor: "Courage is a proud and gleaming shield. It does not bend or hide from sight. To fight with courage, we must forge in steel."
cards.name: Veteran Armorsmith
cards.text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +0/+1.

cards.flavor: "Truth is a straight, keen edge. There are no soft angles or rounded edges. To fight for truth, we must forge in steel."
cards.name: Veteran Swordsmith
cards.text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Secluded Steppe
cards.text:
Secluded Steppe enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
Cycling {W} ({W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Kiora, the Crashing Wave
cards.text:
+1: Until your next turn, prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by target permanent an opponent controls.
−1: Draw a card. You may play an additional land this turn.
−5: You get an emblem with "At the beginning of your end step, put a 9/9 blue Kraken creature token onto the battlefield."

cards.flavor:
"Learn not only from the failures of the past, but also from its triumphs."
—Isperia
cards.name: Accumulated Knowledge
cards.text: Draw a card, then draw cards equal to the number of cards named Accumulated Knowledge in all graveyards.

cards.flavor: "You can come back once you've learned some manners—and figured out how to reconstitute your physical forms."
cards.name: Ætherize
cards.text: Return all attacking creatures to their owner's hand.

cards.flavor:
"Into its maw went the seventh sea, never to be seen again while the world remains."
—Esper fable
cards.name: Inkwell Leviathan
cards.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Trample
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher
cards.name: Man-o'-War
cards.text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.
cards.name: Omenspeaker
cards.text: When Omenspeaker enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.flavor: "Soulless demon, you are bound to me. Now we will both dwell in oblivion."
cards.name: Peel from Reality
cards.text: Return target creature you control and target creature you don't control to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Scourge of Fleets
cards.text: When Scourge of Fleets enters the battlefield, return each creature your opponents control with toughness X or less to its owner's hand, where X is the number of Islands you control.

cards.name: Sealock Monster
cards.text:
Sealock Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{5}{U}{U}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Sealock Monster becomes monstrous, target land becomes an Island in addition to its other types.

cards.flavor: Surrakar grab things they don't want.
cards.name: Surrakar Banisher
cards.text: When Surrakar Banisher enters the battlefield, you may return target tapped creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor:
"I can see why this appeals to Thassa."
—Kiora
cards.name: Whelming Wave
cards.text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands except for Krakens, Leviathans, Octopuses, and Serpents.

cards.flavor:
"I will never run out of new oceans to explore or new sea-dwellers to embrace as my own."
—Kiora
cards.name: Explore
cards.text:
You may play an additional land this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Torching Krosa would be pointless. It grows faster than it burns.
cards.name: Explosive Vegetation
cards.text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"Don't be fooled. If it were as docile as it looks, it would've died off long ago."
—Yon Basrel, Oran-Rief survivalist
cards.name: Grazing Gladehart
cards.text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: It's not the two heads you should fear. It's the four fangs.
cards.name: Nessian Asp
cards.text:
Reach
{6}{G}: Monstrosity 4. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put four +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

cards.flavor: It is an expert at culling individuals who stray too far from the herd.
cards.name: Netcaster Spider
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Netcaster Spider blocks a creature with flying, Netcaster Spider gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Time to Feed
cards.text: Choose target creature an opponent controls. When that creature dies this turn, you gain 3 life. Target creature you control fights that creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.flavor:
"Nature was slowly heading in the right direction, but we know how to achieve faster results."
—Vorel of the Hull Clade
cards.name: Coiling Oracle
cards.text: When Coiling Oracle enters the battlefield, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put that card into your hand.

cards.flavor: "She may call herself Kiora but I believe she is Thassa, the embodiment of the sea and empress of the depths."
cards.name: Kiora's Follower
cards.text: {T}: Untap another target permanent.

cards.flavor:
"The enlightenment I never found in etherium I have found traced in the coatl's scales."
—Ranalus, vedalken heretic
cards.name: Lorescale Coatl
cards.text: Whenever you draw a card, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Lorescale Coatl.

cards.flavor: The Simic soon discovered that the sky offered as few constraints on size as the sea.
cards.name: Nimbus Swimmer
cards.text:
Flying
Nimbus Swimmer enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor:
"Everything serves a purpose. Even you."
—Vorel of the Hull Clade
cards.name: Plasm Capture
cards.text: Counter target spell. At the beginning of your next precombat main phase, add X mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.flavor:
"We've bred out the shortcomings of the species' natural form and replaced them with assets of our own design."
—Momir Vig
cards.name: Simic Sky Swallower
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor: As the Simic released more of their krasis experiments, they required new habitats, always at the expense of the locals.
cards.name: Urban Evolution
cards.text: Draw three cards. You may play an additional land this turn.

cards.flavor: Without the interfering hands of civilization, nature will always shape itself to its own needs.
cards.name: Evolving Wilds
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"When gods become apathetic, the people will worship anyone who answers their pleas."
—Kiora
cards.name: Temple of the False God
cards.text: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Activate this ability only if you control five or more lands.
